transcript: stationed, in the hollow where the rivulet flowed, the soul-stirring rolling and crackling of musketry was heard, and much farther to the right beyond the dragoons, the officer of the suite pointed out to Bagration a French column that was outflanking us. To the left the horizon was bounded by the adjacent wood. Prince Bagrad6n ordered two battalions from the center to be sent to reinforce the right flank. The officer of the suite ventured to re- mark to the prince that if these battalions went
